Module jonix.common
Package com.tectonica.jonix.common.codelist

Enum EditionTypes

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<EditionTypes>
      • com.tectonica.jonix.common.codelist.EditionTypes
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OnixCodelist, Serializable, Comparable<EditionTypes>, Constable
    public enum EditionTypes
extends Enum<EditionTypes>
implements OnixCodelist
    Enum that corresponds to ONIX Codelist 21

    Description: Edition type

    See Also:
    About ONIX Codelists, ONIX Codelist 21 in Reference Guide

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Enum

        Enum.EnumDesc<E extends Enum<E>>

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant Description
      Abridged_edition
      Content has been shortened: use for abridged, shortened, concise, condensed
      Acting_edition
      Version of a play or script intended for use of those directly involved in a production, usually including full stage directions in addition to the text of the script
      Adapted_edition
      Content has been adapted to serve a different purpose or audience, or from one medium to another: use for dramatization, novelization etc.
      Alternate
      Do not use.
      Annotated_edition
      Content is augmented by the addition of notes
      Bilingual_edition
      Both languages should be specified in the <Language> group.
      Bilingual_facing_page_edition
      Use only where the two languages are presented in parallel on facing pages, or in parallel columns of text on a single page (otherwise use BLL).
      Braille_edition
      Braille edition
      Combined_volume
      An edition in which two or more works also published separately are combined in a single volume; AKA 'omnibus edition', or in comic books a 'trade paperback' (fr: 'intégrale')
      Coursepack
      Content was compiled for a specified educational course
      Critical_edition
      Content includes critical commentary on the text
      Digital_original
      A digital product that, at the time of publication, has or had no print counterpart and that is or was not expected to have a print counterpart for a reasonable time (recommended at least 30 days following publication)
      Easy_to_read_edition
      Book which uses highly simplified wording, clear page layout and typography to ensure the content can be understood by those with intellectual disabilities.
      Edition_with_numbered_copies
      A limited edition in which each copy is individually numbered, and the actual number of copies is strictly limited.
      Edition_with_unnumbered_copies
      A limited edition in which each copy is not individually numbered - but where the actual number of copies is strictly limited.
      Enhanced_edition
      Use for e-publications that have been enhanced with additional text, speech, other audio, video, interactive or other content
      Enlarged_edition
      Content has been enlarged or expanded from that of a previous edition
      Expurgated_edition
      'Offensive' content has been removed
      Facsimile_edition
      Exact reproduction of the content and format of a previous edition
      Festschrift
      A collection of writings published in honor of a person, an institution or a society
      High_readability_edition
      Edition optimised for high readability, typically featuring colored or tinted page backgrounds to reduce contrast, extra letter, word and line spacing to reduce crowding and isolate individual words, simplified page layouts and an open, sans serif font (or occasionally, an unusual font design) intended to aid readability.
      Illustrated_edition
      Content includes extensive illustrations which are not part of other editions
      International_edition
      A product aimed specifically at markets other than the country of original publication, usually titled as an 'International edition' and with specification and/or content changes
      Large_type_large_print_edition
      Large print edition, print sizes 14 to 19pt - see also ULP
      Media_tie_in
      An edition published to coincide with the release of a film, TV program, or electronic game based on the same work.
      Microprint_edition
      A printed edition in a type size too small to be read without a magnifying glass
      Multilingual_edition
      All languages should be specified in the 'Language' group.
      New_edition
      Where no other information is given, or no other coded type or edition numbering is applicable
      Paperback_original
      A product published in any form of soft cover, that at the time of publication, has or had no counterpart in any other format, and that is or was not expected to have such a counterpart for a reasonable time (recommended at least 30 days following publication).
      Prebound_edition
      In the US, a book that was previously bound, normally as a paperback, and has been rebound with a library-quality hardcover binding by a supplier other than the original publisher.
      Revised_edition
      Content has been revised from that of a previous edition (often used when there has been no corresponding increment in the edition number, or no edition numbering is available)
      School_edition
      An edition intended specifically for use in schools
      Signed_edition
      Individually autographed by the author(s)
      Simplified_language_edition
      An edition that uses simplified language, usually for second or additional language learners.
      Special_edition
      Use for anniversary, collectors', de luxe, gift, limited (but prefer codes NUM or UNN as appropriate), autographed (but prefer code SIG as appropriate) edition.
      Student_edition
      Where a text is available in both student and teacher's editions
      Teachers_edition
      Where a text is available in both student and teacher's editions; use also for instructor's or leader's editions, and for editions intended exclusively for educators where no specific student edition is available
      Ultra_large_print_edition
      For print sizes 20pt and above, and with typefaces designed for the visually impaired - see also LTE
      Unabridged_edition
      Where a title has also been published in an abridged edition; also for audiobooks, regardless of whether an abridged audio version also exists
      Unexpurgated_edition
      Content previously considered 'offensive' has been restored
      Variorum_edition
      Content includes notes by various commentators, and/or includes and compares several variant texts of the same work
      Vorlesebucher
      Readaloud edition - specifially intended and designed for reading aloud (to children).

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • Abridged_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Abridged_edition
        Content has been shortened: use for abridged, shortened, concise, condensed

      • Acting_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Acting_edition
        Version of a play or script intended for use of those directly involved in a production, usually including full stage directions in addition to the text of the script

      • Adapted_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Adapted_edition
        Content has been adapted to serve a different purpose or audience, or from one medium to another: use for dramatization, novelization etc. Use <EditionStatement> to describe the exact nature of the adaptation

      • Alternate

        public static final EditionTypes Alternate
        Do not use. This code is now DEPRECATED, but is retained in the list for reasons of backwards compatibility

      • Annotated_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Annotated_edition
        Content is augmented by the addition of notes

      • Bilingual_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Bilingual_edition
        Both languages should be specified in the <Language> group. Use MLL for an edition in more than two languages

      • Bilingual_facing_page_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Bilingual_facing_page_edition
        Use only where the two languages are presented in parallel on facing pages, or in parallel columns of text on a single page (otherwise use BLL). Both languages should be specified in the <Language> group

      • Braille_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Braille_edition
        Braille edition

      • Combined_volume

        public static final EditionTypes Combined_volume
        An edition in which two or more works also published separately are combined in a single volume; AKA 'omnibus edition', or in comic books a 'trade paperback' (fr: 'intégrale')

      • Critical_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Critical_edition
        Content includes critical commentary on the text

      • Coursepack

        public static final EditionTypes Coursepack
        Content was compiled for a specified educational course

      • Digital_original

        public static final EditionTypes Digital_original
        A digital product that, at the time of publication, has or had no print counterpart and that is or was not expected to have a print counterpart for a reasonable time (recommended at least 30 days following publication)

      • Enhanced_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Enhanced_edition
        Use for e-publications that have been enhanced with additional text, speech, other audio, video, interactive or other content

      • Enlarged_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Enlarged_edition
        Content has been enlarged or expanded from that of a previous edition

      • Easy_to_read_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Easy_to_read_edition
        Book which uses highly simplified wording, clear page layout and typography to ensure the content can be understood by those with intellectual disabilities. See https://www.inclusion-europe.eu/easy-to-read for guidelines. See also SMP for editions with simplified language. Only for use in ONIX 3.0 or later

        Jonix-Comment: Introduced in Onix3

      • Expurgated_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Expurgated_edition
        'Offensive' content has been removed

      • Facsimile_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Facsimile_edition
        Exact reproduction of the content and format of a previous edition

      • Festschrift

        public static final EditionTypes Festschrift
        A collection of writings published in honor of a person, an institution or a society

      • High_readability_edition

        public static final EditionTypes High_readability_edition
        Edition optimised for high readability, typically featuring colored or tinted page backgrounds to reduce contrast, extra letter, word and line spacing to reduce crowding and isolate individual words, simplified page layouts and an open, sans serif font (or occasionally, an unusual font design) intended to aid readability. Sometimes labelled 'dyslexia-friendly'. See also code SMP if the text itself is simplified, and codes LTE or ULP if the type size is significantly larger than normal. Only for use in ONIX 3.0 or later

        Jonix-Comment: Introduced in Onix3

      • Illustrated_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Illustrated_edition
        Content includes extensive illustrations which are not part of other editions

      • International_edition

        public static final EditionTypes International_edition
        A product aimed specifically at markets other than the country of original publication, usually titled as an 'International edition' and with specification and/or content changes

      • Large_type_large_print_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Large_type_large_print_edition
        Large print edition, print sizes 14 to 19pt - see also ULP

      • Microprint_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Microprint_edition
        A printed edition in a type size too small to be read without a magnifying glass

      • Media_tie_in

        public static final EditionTypes Media_tie_in
        An edition published to coincide with the release of a film, TV program, or electronic game based on the same work. Use <EditionStatement> to describe the exact nature of the tie-in

      • Multilingual_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Multilingual_edition
        All languages should be specified in the 'Language' group. Use BLL for a bilingual edition

      • New_edition

        public static final EditionTypes New_edition
        Where no other information is given, or no other coded type or edition numbering is applicable

      • Edition_with_numbered_copies

        public static final EditionTypes Edition_with_numbered_copies
        A limited edition in which each copy is individually numbered, and the actual number of copies is strictly limited. Note that the supplier may limit the number of orders fulfilled per retail outlet. Use <EditionStatement> to give details of the number of copies printed

      • Paperback_original

        public static final EditionTypes Paperback_original
        A product published in any form of soft cover, that at the time of publication, has or had no counterpart in any other format, and that is or was not expected to have such a counterpart for a reasonable time (recommended at least 30 days following publication). Only for use in ONIX 3.0 or later

        Jonix-Comment: Introduced in Onix3

      • Prebound_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Prebound_edition
        In the US, a book that was previously bound, normally as a paperback, and has been rebound with a library-quality hardcover binding by a supplier other than the original publisher. See also the <Publisher> and <RelatedProduct> composites for other aspects of the treatment of prebound editions in ONIX

      • Revised_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Revised_edition
        Content has been revised from that of a previous edition (often used when there has been no corresponding increment in the edition number, or no edition numbering is available)

      • School_edition

        public static final EditionTypes School_edition
        An edition intended specifically for use in schools

      • Signed_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Signed_edition
        Individually autographed by the author(s)

      • Simplified_language_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Simplified_language_edition
        An edition that uses simplified language, usually for second or additional language learners. See ETR for highly simplified editions for readers with intellectual disabilities

      • Special_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Special_edition
        Use for anniversary, collectors', de luxe, gift, limited (but prefer codes NUM or UNN as appropriate), autographed (but prefer code SIG as appropriate) edition. Use <EditionStatement> to describe the exact nature of the special edition

      • Student_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Student_edition
        Where a text is available in both student and teacher's editions

      • Teachers_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Teachers_edition
        Where a text is available in both student and teacher's editions; use also for instructor's or leader's editions, and for editions intended exclusively for educators where no specific student edition is available

      • Unabridged_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Unabridged_edition
        Where a title has also been published in an abridged edition; also for audiobooks, regardless of whether an abridged audio version also exists

      • Ultra_large_print_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Ultra_large_print_edition
        For print sizes 20pt and above, and with typefaces designed for the visually impaired - see also LTE

      • Edition_with_unnumbered_copies

        public static final EditionTypes Edition_with_unnumbered_copies
        A limited edition in which each copy is not individually numbered - but where the actual number of copies is strictly limited. Note that the supplier may limit the number of orders fulfilled per retail outlet. Use <EditionStatement> to give details of the number of copies printed

      • Unexpurgated_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Unexpurgated_edition
        Content previously considered 'offensive' has been restored

      • Variorum_edition

        public static final EditionTypes Variorum_edition
        Content includes notes by various commentators, and/or includes and compares several variant texts of the same work

      • Vorlesebucher

        public static final EditionTypes Vorlesebucher
        Readaloud edition - specifially intended and designed for reading aloud (to children). Only for use in ONIX 3.0 or later

        Jonix-Comment: Introduced in Onix3
